fee_structure.demonstrate_a_theoretical_understanding_: Demonstrate evidence-based conceptualization of neuropsychiatric cases, assessments and interventions through practicum and laboratory exposure
Generate ideas, arguments, proposals or solutions in designing and performing research; and communicate research findings through manuscripts, short reports, case studies, and meta-analysis
Advocate the field through engagement with community stakeholders by providing neuropsychological services
Demonstrate awareness and analysis of ethical issues and discuss and apply strategies to address ethics and laws associated with the research and practice of neuropsychology

eligibility:
PO1:
Demonstrate a theoretical understanding and evidence-based conceptualization of relevant neuropsychological domains including neuroanatomy, neurophysiology and the cognitive and neurobiological basis of behaviour
PO2:
Demonstrate evidence-based conceptualization of neuropsychiatric cases, assessments and interventions through practicum and laboratory exposure
PO3:
Generate ideas, arguments, proposals or solutions in designing and performing research; and communicate research findings through manuscripts, short reports, case studies, and meta-analysis
PO4:
Advocate the field through engagement with community stakeholders by providing neuropsychological services
PO5:
Demonstrate awareness and analysis of ethical issues and discuss and apply strategies to address ethics and laws associated with the research and practice of neuropsychology
why_choose: Why choose this course? To gain a comprehensive theoretical knowledge of brain functions Dedicated training on assessments and interventions for cognitive enhancement Research-focused curriculum with training in conducting research projects Access to advanced techniques: EEG, Biofeedback, Neurofeedback Small group and one-on-one mentoring from Faculty to ensure well being Supervised student-run well-being sessions
what_learn: What you will learn? Theoretical knowledge base in neuroanatomy, neurophysiology, social and cognitive basis of human behaviour; along with a developmental perspective of the same. Evidence-based conceptualization of neuropsychiatric cases, assessments and interventions through practicum and laboratory exposure To generate ideas, arguments, proposals or solutions in designing and performing research; and communicate research findings through manuscripts, short reports, case studies, and meta-analysis To advocate the field through engagement with community stakeholders by providing neuropsychological services Analyze ethical issues and discuss and apply strategies to address ethics and laws associated with the research and practice of neuropsychology
modules: Modules Training on quantitative data analysis using SPSS and JAMOVI. Administration and interpretation of various developmental assessments Year 1 Critical evaluation of conceptual approaches to etiology and treatment of psychological disorders. Journal Club with critical reading of current research articles. Laboratory practicum in Eye-Tracking, Biofeedback, and Neurofeedback. Year 2 In-depth understanding of licensure and practice of Neuropsychology in India
career: Career prospects Neuropsychological Assessments and testing Neuropsychological Enhancement and Rehabilitation services Research Fellow appointments in Research organizations Entrepreneurial and Associate role in Advocacy, Action Research and Policy related work in the NGO sector Undergraduate Teaching and academic assistantships Startup opportunities that can be incubated through CHRIST Innovation and Incubation centers.
